title: Start with a Problem
description: The best talks solve real problems. Share a challenge you faced and how you solved it. Audiences connect with 'I had this problem too' moments.

title: Be Specific
description: Avoid generic topics like 'Introduction to React Native'. Instead, try 'How We Reduced Our App Bundle Size by 60%' â€” specific, measurable, interesting.

title: Show, Don't Tell
description: Include code examples, demos, or case studies. Conference organizers love proposals that promise live coding or real-world examples.

title: Know Your Audience
description: Research the conference. App.js is Expo-focused, Chain React is community-driven. Tailor your proposal to fit the conference's vibe.

title: Submit Early
description: Most CFPs have hundreds of submissions. Earlier submissions often get more attention. Don't wait until the last day.

title: Include Your Background
description: Why are you the right person to give this talk? Include relevant experience, previous talks, or projects that establish credibility.
